src:
枚方市にある「大阪市立高校」、府移管で改名の岐路

07 Nov 2019, 10:06



大阪府枚方市にある「大阪市立高校」














　大阪府枚方市にある「大阪市立高校（おおさかしりつこうこう）」の名称変更の可能性が高まっている。大阪府教委と大阪市教委が、２０２２年度に市立の高校２１校をすべて府に移管する方針を固めたためだ。現校名のまま府立になることは想定しづらいが、卒業生からは「できることなら校名を残して」との声が上がっている。
　愛称は「いちりつ」。京阪光善寺駅近くの小高い場所にある。普通科、英語科、理数科で約１０００人が学ぶ。大阪市内から通うのは１５％ほどだという。
　１９４１年、大阪市此花区の酉島（とりしま）工業学校に間借りして、同市立では初の旧制中学校「大阪市立中学校」として開校した。市外も含めて校地を探し、枚方町（現枚方市）の誘致を受けた。
　現在の場所に移ったのは４３年。竹やぶだった土地の開墾には生徒も加わった。グラウンドの整備は長く続き、５３年入学の岡林秀幸さん（８２）は「体育の時間はいつも、スコップで山の土を運んでいた」と振り返る。



　創立５０周年記念誌（９１年刊）によると、４８年の学制改革の際に、複数の市立高校が誕生することになり、校名が問題に。職員会議を経て「大阪市立枚方高校」とすることが一度は決まり、学校印やゴム印も作った。
　しかし、大阪市から「枚方という地名をつけるのは好ましくない」と指摘され、断念。大阪市立高校となった。２年後には、生徒に希望の校名をアンケートした。校内に多数の桜が植えられていることにちなむ「桜ヶ丘」が最多だったが、同名の学校が全国に多いとして、変更は見送られた。
　７８年には「大阪市民以外も通う学校を、大阪市の費用で運営するのはおかしい」と、府への移管が持ち上がった。市は有償での譲渡を求め、折り合わなかった。
　現在、府教委と市教委が打ち出している高校の移管は、両教委の役割分担を明確にし、広域的な方針で高校を運営するのが狙い。府、市は来夏までに計画をまとめる。移管後の校名は「府、市で協議し、府が決める」とされている。
　市立高同窓会の池田隆司会長は「卒業生は皆、『いちりつ』の呼び名に愛着がある。これから先も、あの場所に今の名前で続いてほしいというのが、同窓会の思いだ」と語る。
　一方、枚方市の伏見隆市長は「寂しさを感じる人は多いだろうとは思うが、もし、校名が変更されるのなら、ぜひ『枚方』を入れてほしい」としている。
text:
"Osaka City High School" in Hirakata City, renamed by prefecture transfer

07 Nov 2019, 10:06



"Osaka City High School" in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture














The possibility of changing the name of “Osaka Municipal High School” in Hirakata City, Osaka Prefecture is increasing. This is because the Osaka Prefectural Board of Education and the Osaka City Board of Education have decided to transfer all 21 municipal high schools to the prefectural government in 2022. Although it is difficult to assume that the current school name will be prefectural, graduates are saying that if possible, leave the school name.
Nickname is “Ichiritsu”. It is in a small place near Keihan Kozenji Station. Approximately 1000 students study in the General Course, English Course, and Science and Mathematics Course. About 15% go from Osaka city.
In 1941, it was borrowed from Torishima Technical School in Konohana-ku, Osaka City and opened as the first former junior high school “Osaka City Junior High School”. We looked for school grounds, including outside the city, and were invited by Hirakata Town (currently Hirakata City).
”It moved to the current location in 43 years. Students also participated in the reclamation of the land that was bamboo bamboo. The construction of the ground continued for a long time, and Hideyuki Okabayashi (82), who entered in 2003, recalls that “the physical education time always carried the mountain soil with a scoop”.



According to the 50th anniversary magazine (published in 1991), several municipal high schools were born during the 48-year school reform, and the school name became a problem. After the staff meeting, it was decided once to be "Osaka City Hirakata High School" and made school stamps and rubber stamps.
However, Osaka City pointed out that “it is not desirable to give the place name Hirakata” and gave up. It became Osaka City High School. Two years later, students were asked a questionnaire about the desired school name. “Sakuragaoka” was the most frequented by many cherry trees planted in the school, but the change was postponed because there were many schools of the same name in the whole country.
In 1978, the transfer to the prefecture was raised, saying, “It is strange to run a school that is not attended by Osaka citizens at the expense of Osaka City.” The city requested a transfer for a fee and did not make a deal.
Currently, the transfer of high school, which is established by the prefectural and city faculty committees, aims to clarify the division of roles between the two school committees and operate the high school in a wide-area policy. Fu and city will complete plans by next summer. The name of the school after the transfer is said to be “determined by the prefecture and city”.
“The graduates are all fond of the name“ Ichitsu ”. I hope that the alumni association will continue in that place with the current name,” says Takashi Ikeda, chairman of the municipal high school alumni association.
On the other hand, Mayor Takashi Fushimi of Hirakata City says, “I think that there are many people who feel loneliness, but if the school name is changed, I would like you to include“ Hirakata ”.”
